meanings.definition: A member of the phylum Mollusca, typically having a soft body enclosed in a shell.
meanings.sent1: The molluscans in the aquarium were colorful and fascinating to watch.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study molluscans to learn more about marine life.
meanings.sent3: The molluscans had a party in their shells, complete with tiny decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her love for molluscans was as deep as the ocean they lived in.
meanings.sent5: The children's book featured a brave molluscan on an adventure.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of molluscs.
meanings.sent1: The molluscan creatures had unique patterns on their shells.
meanings.sent2: The molluscan habitat provided a safe environment for various species.
meanings.sent3: The molluscan fashion show featured elegant shell accessories.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as smooth and shiny as a molluscan shell.
meanings.sent5: The molluscan exhibit showcased the diversity of sea life.
